file_content.text: Like a child mutilating a doll, you have triumphed over primitive technology.
But you cannot conceive of the weapons I possess. Things your kind was not permitted to see.
You keep talking about "forbidden tech"... how'd you get it?
What weapons are those?
My benefactors have been useful, at times.
Listen--I'm not here to harm you. I just need information.
We shouldn't be enemies.
Your weakness is not mine. I find no value in negotiation.
Your threats are getting old. Let's settle this.
I'm tired of your bluster.
Not yet. But everything is on schedule.
When you destroyed the core machine, you unleashed my microdroid swarm. Automata like gnats that can drill through flesh.
They will infect your associate, and by the time you reach Megasecurity Ward 23, you will stand alone.
You already stand alone. By the time you reach Megasecurity Ward 23 you will be on your knees, trembling.
So few creatures seek to penetrate Megasecurity Ward 23. My benefactors hide themselves too well and deprive me of entertainment.
It blinded and destroyed them.
You seek what my benefactors hid. For what purpose?
Their ambitions are not my concern, but so too are they beyond your understanding.
You are now a carrier, too. It is unlikely to kill you, but the symptoms are unpleasant.
It is an interspecies disease eliminated in the wider galaxy but secretly stored on Belsavis.
The poor creatures before you are innocent carriers of a plague called the Blue Crescent virus.
If you think you're going to find a great secret in Megasecurity Ward 23, I assure you that you will not.
My benefactors have put a thousand years of forbidden technology at my disposal, and I can stop you at any time.
The only question is how to do so most effectively.
I can see you through my monitors. Away from your gang, you shed your identity and take on new attributes.
I prefer you in this form. You are slightly less predictable, and bear further observation.
